medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Splenomegaly identified at age 3. At age 7, developed intestinal obstruction due to mesenteric lymphadenopathy and severe thrombocytopenia requiring splenectomy. At age 18, diagnosed with chronic hepatitis C with persistent viremia despite treatment. At age 25, adenopathy leading to cervical lymph node biopsy showed reactive follicular hyperplasia. Cervical lymphadenopathy recurred at age 27, accompanied by fever, weight loss, and itching, ultimately diagnosed as diffuse large-B-cell lymphoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Autoimmune lymphoproliferative syndrome (ALPS) diagnosed; chronic hepatitis C infection.
medical_history.family_history: Fas mutation inherited from healthy father and present in healthy brother; Prf1 mutation inherited from healthy mother.
